compliant.section: Other Users and Third Parties You Share Information With

non_compliant.section: As noted above, we may use Content you provide us to improve our Services, for example to train the models that power ChatGPT . Read our instructions (opens in a new window) on how you can opt out of our use of your Content to train our models . 3 .
non_compliant.amend: The policy should clearly state the specific legitimate interests pursued by OpenAI in using user content for training models. It should also provide a clear and accessible mechanism for users to opt out of this use, ensuring that the opt-out process is simple and effective.

non_compliant.section: In certain circumstances we may provide your Personal Information to third parties without further notice to you, unless required by the law:
non_compliant.legal provisions: Information to be provided to the data subject
non_compliant.amend: The policy should provide clear and concise information to data subjects about the circumstances under which their personal information may be disclosed to third parties, including the categories of recipients and the purposes of the disclosure. It should also specify the legal basis for such disclosure.

non_compliant.section: Pursuant to our instructions, these parties will access, process, or store Personal Information only in the course of performing their duties to us .
non_compliant.amend: The policy should explicitly state that OpenAI has entered into written contracts with its vendors and service providers that comply with the requirements of Article 28 of the GDPR, ensuring that these processors provide sufficient guarantees to implement appropriate technical and organizational measures to protect personal data.

non_compliant.section: Business Transfers: If we are involved in strategic transactions, reorganization, bankruptcy, receivership, or transition of service to another provider (collectively, a “Transaction”), your Personal Information and other information may be disclosed in the diligence process with counterparties and others assisting with the Transaction and transferred to a successor or affiliate as part of that Transaction along with other assets .
non_compliant.amend: The policy should specify the appropriate safeguards implemented to ensure the protection of personal data during business transfers, such as data encryption, anonymization, or other suitable measures. It should also clearly outline the process for informing data subjects about such transfers.

non_compliant.section: Legal Requirements: We may share your Personal Information, including information about your interaction with our Services, with government authorities, industry peers, or other third parties (i) if required to do so by law or in the good faith belief that such action is necessary to comply with a legal obligation, (ii) to protect and defend our rights or property, (iii) if we determine, in our sole discretion, that there is a violation of our terms, policies, or the law; (iv) to detect or prevent fraud or other illegal activity; (v) to protect the safety, security, and integrity of our products, employees, or users, or the public, or (vi) to protect against legal liability .
non_compliant.amend: The policy should provide more specific examples of the legal obligations that may necessitate the disclosure of personal information to government authorities or other third parties. It should also clarify the criteria used to determine the good faith belief that such disclosure is necessary.

non_compliant.section: Affiliates: We may disclose Personal Information to our affiliates, meaning an entity that controls, is controlled by, or is under common control with OpenAI . Our affiliates may use the Personal Information we share in a manner consistent with this Privacy Policy .
non_compliant.amend: The policy should explicitly state whether OpenAI has implemented binding corporate rules (BCRs) to govern the transfer of personal data to its affiliates. If BCRs are in place, the policy should provide a link to the relevant BCRs or a summary of their key provisions.

non_compliant.section: Business Account Administrators: When you join a ChatGPT Enterprise or business account, the administrators of that account may access and control your OpenAI account .
non_compliant.amend: The policy should clearly explain the specific legitimate interests pursued by OpenAI in allowing business account administrators to access and control user accounts. It should also provide information about the measures taken to ensure the security and confidentiality of user data within these business accounts.

non_compliant.section: In addition, if you create an account using an email address belonging to your employer or another organization, we may share the fact that you have an OpenAI account and certain account information, such as your email address, with your employer or organization to, for example, enable you to be added to their business account .
non_compliant.amend: The policy should clearly state that OpenAI obtains explicit consent from users before sharing their account information with their employer or organization. It should also provide a clear and accessible mechanism for users to withdraw their consent at any time.

non_compliant.section: Other Users and Third Parties You Share Information With: Certain features allow you to display or share information with other users or third parties . For example, you may share ChatGPT conversations with other users via shared links or send information to third-party applications via custom actions for GPTs .
non_compliant.amend: The policy should clearly explain the specific types of information that users may share with other users or third parties through the use of these features. It should also provide clear and concise information about the data processing activities undertaken by OpenAI in relation to this shared information.
